title: U.S. may extend tariff exemptions on $34 billion of Chinese imports
text: The U.S. Trade Representative's office said Monday it is considering extending tariff exemptions on $34 billion in Chinese goods. In a statement, the office said it will accept arguments for or against extending exemptions from Nov. 1 until Nov. 30. The current exclusions apply to about 1,000 products that were approved last December to be exempt from 25% tariffs on Chinese imports that were put into effect in July 2018. The 12-month exclusions are set to expire on Dec. 28. The possible extension comes as U.S. and Chinese negotiators are trying to hammer out a "phase one" trade deal, which could include a reprieve from a new round of tariffs on $250 billion in Chinese goods, which were postponed from taking effect Oct. 1. President Donald Trump said Monday that the trade talks were looking to be ahead of schedule.
